content.description: Start standing on a small shelf with a good left hand undercling and right hand jug. Move up and right to a pair of incut edges, and then left to a good sloper crimp. From here, make a long move up to a good side pull, and slap the lip. There is a decent pinch/sloper on the lip just above the final side pull, and a hidden jug above it.
content.location: Directly up the left side of the Grilled Cheese boulder

content.description: Sit start low on an obvious pocket, pull up to match on a sloper before entering the crux. Execute a unique sequence on crimps and slopers leading to the good edge on the arete, make a few more tension moves to a jug on the right side of the apex of the boulder and press out the top.
content.location: Just to the left of 'The Gambler' is an obvious right leaning sloping arete. Sit start in the obvious pocket hold at the base.

content.description:
Good movement out the steep overhang that goes at a lower grade than originally anticipated for this steep line,due to good feet throughout the route. 

  Start on a triangle shape cutout with your right hand and a pyramid shaped hold with your left. Pull on the wall with the aid of a heel hook and grab the 1 inch thick rail(a really cool hold), now make a long move to a good in-cut and bump to a jug, move your feet around and top out.
content.location: Behind the 15 foot tall vertical face is the cool overhang

content.description: Start on two opposing side pulls, the left in the crack and the right on the flake, below the shelves. Pull on and make your way up the good shelves, and into the corer above before topping out on jugs.
content.location: This is in the center of the boulder where the taller section meets the shorter section. This is also the most obvious line on the wall.

content.description:
Start on the crimps at the six-foot mark, pull on and move up to the crimps above before manteling the top out.

 This line climbs well but it is personally a bit of a disappointment. When I originally cleaned it, there was a single pad crimp rail that would have made it a good squat start with a hard move into the current starting hold, but it exploded off the wall...

 Beta Video: youtube.com/watch?v=eTmgHpp…
content.location: This is located about 100 feet to the left of the proper Grilled Cheese boulder. It has a birch leaning against it.

content.description:
The shortest and lowest quality route on the wall, but an obvious line and a decent warm-up. On the right side of the wall locate the good sloper, pull on and climb up incuts in the flake to jugs at the lip.

 Beta Video: youtube.com/watch?v=v7MSYBJ…
content.location: The rightmost line on the wall. Start on the good sloper with positive feet.

content.description: A stand alone 15 foot vertical face with several lines on it, as well as the roof boulder behind it.
